task_summary: Grasp the cabinet drawer handle and open the drawer, then retreat and release.

task_long_description.overview: A mobile manipulator (Stretch) is positioned in front of a kitchen cabinet under a countertop. The target is a mid-level drawer with a bar-style handle. The robot must perceive the handle, align its gripper, grasp it, execute the opening motion (modeled via an OpenContainer action for a drawer), retreat slightly to avoid collision with the front face and surroundings, and finally release the handle. The sequence emphasizes reliable perception, precise alignment, and a smooth opening motion consistent with the frames.
preconditions: Robot has line of sight to the cabinet drawer handle
Workspace around the drawer is unobstructed
Gripper functional and free of objects
stepwise_plan: Open gripper and detect the drawer handle.
Confirm visibility and compute a pull grasp pose.
Move to pre-grasp, set yaw, approach and align to the handle.
Close gripper to secure the handle.
Retreat slightly and release the handle.
success_criteria: Drawer translates outward from the cabinet by a visible margin
No collisions with cabinet or countertop
Robot ends in a safe, slightly retracted pose
failure_and_recovery: If detection fails, re-run perception and recompute grasp pose.
If alignment fails, re-approach with tighter tolerance.
If opening stalls, retreat a little and retry the opening motion.
task_long_description.termination: When the drawer is open and the handle has been released with the robot safely retracted.

frame_3.now_evidence: Gripper aligned close to the handle with clear contact geometry.
frame_3.predicts_next: Initiation of opening motion along drawer’s slide axis.

node_specs.description: Compute a pull grasp for the handle.
Verify grasp pose exists on blackboard.
Orient gripper to align with bar handle.
Close in and align to handle.
Back off to a safe pose.

failure_modes: Handle not detected or partially occluded
Drawer friction too high to open
recovery_strategy: Repeat DetectObject and ComputeGraspPose with a new view
Abort if force/contacts suggest collision risk
assumptions: The visible handle is bar-type and suitable for a pulling grasp.
Opening direction is outward along the drawer slides; modeled via OpenContainer(drawer).
Yaw of 90° aligns the gripper with the handle orientation seen in frames.

expected_success_criteria: Drawer front panel translates outward and remains open
No visible collision with cabinet or counter
